physical_appearance:This is a letter written to J. Steele. It is printed in black ink on a white sheet of paper. The letterhead is printed at the top of the document
 with a logo in the center. There is another logo by the addressee on the left. The date is printed at the top right. The content of the letter is slightly faded. There is a horizontal tear along the right side below the letterhead.

 1939-1945 Letters War crimes

subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:A 1946 letter written to Steele asking for help in the Japanese War Crimes investigation of the deaths of 18 members of his regiment at Paya Lebar. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Letter written to Steele asking for help in a Japanese War Crimes investigation
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a letter written to J. Steele. It is printed in black ink on a white sheet of paper. The letterhead is printed at the top of the document, with a logo in the center. There is another logo by the addressee on the left. The date is printed at the top right. The content of the letter is slightly faded. There is a horizontal tear along the right side below the letterhead.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A 1946 letter written to Steele asking for help in the Japanese War Crimes investigation of the deaths of 18 members of his regiment at Paya Lebar. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
